intro: Chazaliella insidens, commonly known as the insidious chazaliella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. It typically grows as a low shrub or perennial herb, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure member of the carrot family.
